user_request: Show the shopping cart on amazon. Add "macbook air" to the cart on amazon
screen_desc: This screenshot shows the Amazon product page for a refurbished MacBook Air priced at $390.00. The item is listed as in "Excellent condition" and comes with a 90-day Amazon Renewed Guarantee. The delivery is expected by Monday, November 14, and it is available for shipping to the Netherlands. The user can choose the quantity and either "Add to Cart" or "Buy Now." The item is "In Stock" and ships from Amazon, sold by Platinum Deals.
history_actions: click on the "Chrome" browser app icon located at the lower right part of the screen.
click on the browser's address/URL bar located at the middle and top part of the screen.
click on the second search suggestion located at middle and upper part of the screen.
click on the shopping cart icon located at the top right.
click on the shopping cart icon located at the top right.
click on the shopping cart icon located at the top right.
click on the search bar located at the upper middle part of the screen.
click on the first search result with content "2020 Apple MacBook Air Laptop Apple M1 Chip, 13" Retina Display,,8GB RAM, 256GB SSD Storage," located at the upper right
click on the product image (of a MacBook Air) of second search result located at the middle left

The current screen demonstrates the product page for a refurbished MacBook Air which the user intends to add to the shopping cart. The 'Add to Cart' button is clearly visible on the screen. The next single-step action would be to click on the 'Add to Cart' button to add the MacBook Air to the shopping cart. After that, a future action could be to click on the shopping cart icon to show the shopping cart as per the user's request.
